name: Sharifa Sultana
content: Sharifa Sultana top of pageAbout Me ​ I am a human-computer interaction (HCI) and human-AI interaction (HAI) researcher. I connect computing, justice, faith, and access together to support the empowerment of communities worldwide. I have expertise in HCI, AI, design theory, postcoloniality, feminism, and science and technology studies (STS). I have been working with rural communities in Bangladesh and Muslim immigrants in North America for the last nine years. I use both quantitative and qualitative (ethnographic) techniques and ethics frameworks to study and design computational tools and systems. My research has brought novel perspectives into Resposible AI, HAI, HCI, and information and communication technology for development (ICTD). ​ I am an Assistant Professor in Computer Science at UIUC. I completed my Ph.D. in Information Science at Cornell University in 2023. I was advised by Dr. Susan R. Fussell. Before Cornell, I was a Lecturer of Computer Science (CS) at the Independent University, Bangladesh. Previously I was also a Lecturer of Computer Science and Engineering (CSE) at the University of South Asia, Bangladesh. Before that, I worked for PrimeSilicon Technologies (Bangladesh), as a Placement and Routing (PnR) Engineer. I obtained my undergraduate degree in Electrical and Electronic Engineering (EEE) from Bangladesh University of Engineering and Technology (BUET), majoring in Telecommunication Engineering and Digital Signal Processing. ​ My areas of interest are: HCI4D, HCI-Design, HAI, Responsible AI. ​​ ​ Contact me with your CV & SOP if you are a prospective student, and/or fill in the Google Form if you are looking to work with me. ​ ​ ​ Recent and Upcoming Events​​​​​ October 18, 2025: Paper got accepted at CIES 2026. ​Reimagining Language Learning: A Gesture-Based Approach to Enhancing Persian Language Preservation April 20, 2025: Paper got accepted at DIS 2025. ‘Socheton’: A Culturally Appropriate AI Tool to Support Reproductive Well-being. I have received the 2025 Sheth Distinguished Faculty Award for International Achievement. Jan 27, 2025: Paper got accepted at CHI 2025. Talking About the Assumption in the Room. Dec 25, 2024: Paper got accepted at iConference 2025. ​Analysis of the integration of e-commerce and rural lives in China​ Oct 4, 2024: Paper got accepted at ACM GROUP 2025.​ "My very subjective human interpretation": domain expert perspectives on navigating the text analysis loop for topic models. Sept 12, 2024: Paper got accepted at ICTD 2024.​ The Ancient Elephant in the Room: Stigma, Gender Norms, and Cultural Barriers in Reproductive Care in Bangladesh. I am serving the ICTD 2024 organizing team as the Notes Chair.​​​ bottom of page
